respondents: the company or even between the son and any of the assets of the company. In the circumstances, the directions sought in paragraphs 6(a) of the report are refused. 2. The wife of the director was also a director of the company. Hence the report is made absolute in terms of paragraph 6(b). Mr.Pratap states that the director s wife is not aware of the working of the company as she was not incharge of the affairs of the company. Be that as it may, an affidavit is required to be filed by her. Affidavit shall be filed within eight weeks from today.
judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
 ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION
 OFFICIAL LIQUIDATOR S REPORT NO.59 OF 2009
 IN
 COMPANY PETITION NO.249 OF 1986
 In the matter of M/s.Diram Chemicals
 Private Limited (In Liquidation)
 M/s.Progressive Chemicals, Bombay ....Petitioner
 Mr.P.S. Pratap for Mr.D.K.Desai and Mrs.M.K. Desai.
 Mr.P. Ramarao, Official Liquidator present.
 CORAM : S.J. VAZIFDAR, J.
 DATED : 26TH FEBRUARY, 2009.
 P.C. :
 1. There is nothing on record which warrants
 impleading the son of the director against whom
 misfeasance proceedings were initiated. The director
 expired in March, 2001. His son was not a director of
 the company. The report does not indicate any
 connection between the son and the company or even
 between the son and any of the assets of the company.
 In the circumstances, the directions sought in
 paragraphs 6(a) of the report are refused.
 2. The wife of the director was also a director
 of the company. Hence the report is made absolute in
 terms of paragraph 6(b). Mr.Pratap states that the
 director s wife is not aware of the working of the
 company as she was not incharge of the affairs of the
 company. Be that as it may, an affidavit is required
 to be filed by her. Affidavit shall be filed within
 eight weeks from today.
